ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
MetaTrial Visit ID
Notes: System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files

ElementDescription:
Does the patient need reminders or advice to
manage chores, do shopping, cooking, play
games, or handle money?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Occasionally at least once a month; 2 = Frequently at least once a week

ElementDescription:
Does the patient need help to remember
important things such as appointments,
recent events, or names of family or friends?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Occasionally at least once a month; 2 = Frequently at least once a week

ElementDescription:
Does the patient need frequent (at least once a month) help finding misplaced objects,
keeping appointments, or maintaining health
or safety (locking doors, taking medication)?
Does the patient need household chore done for them?
Does the patient need to be watched or kept company when awake?
Does the patient need to be escorted when outside
Does the patient need to be accompanied when bathing or eating
Does the patient have to be dressed, washed and groomed?
Does the patient have to be taken to toilet regularly to avoid incontinence
Does the patient have to be fed?
Does the patient need to be turned, moved or transferred?
Does the patient wear a diaper or a catheter?
Does the patient need to be tube fed?
Equivalent Institutional Care
Notes: 1 = Limited home care; 2 = Adult home; 3 = Health-related facility

ElementDescription: Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits

ElementDescription: Dependence level
Notes: 0 = Level 0; 1 = Level 1; 2 = Level 2; 3 = Level 3; 4 = Level 4; 5 = Level 5; A patient may meet the criteria for more than one level. If this is the case, we have assigned the highest level the patient meets. For example, if a patient meets the criteria for both Levels 4 and 5, assign DEPNDNCE = 5.

ElementDescription: Flag Baseline Phase 1/1A Visit
Notes: 1=Yes for all records meeting this criteria

ElementDescription: Flag Last Phase 1/1A Visit
Notes: 1=Yes for all records meeting this criteria

ElementDescription: Baseline Dependence Level
Change from Baseline in Dependence Level
Current Phase. Phase patient was in at the time of the assessment Phase 4 refers to the follow-up phase.
ValueRange: Pre-Rand; Phase 1/1A; Phase 2; Phase 3; Phase 4; Phase 1B; Open-Choice Phase; Screening; Phase 1
